page.title: 02Badlesmere : Tourism
page.content: Tourism is a growth industry promoted locally by the South East Tourist Board. There is no major tourist attraction in the area apart from local churches but many tourists use it as a base to visit Canterbury, Faversham, Leeds Castle, Chilham and even London taking advantage of bed and breakfast type accommodation offered by pubs and private houses at an average cost of Â£7 - Â£1O per person, per night. About 7O% of tourists are from The Netherlands, arriving at Sheerness via Vlissingen on the Olau Ferry Line. Another lO% are Americans (often trying to trace their ancestry) and the remainder are mostly British and other Europeans who are just passing through on the way to or from Dover.
